Package cetus.hir

Class SymbolTools

  • java.lang.Object
    • cetus.hir.SymbolTools
  • public final class SymbolTools
extends java.lang.Object
    SymbolTools provides tools for interfacing symbol tables and related searches.

    • Method Detail

      • linkSymbol

        public static void linkSymbol​(Traversable t)
        Makes links from all IDExpression objects in the program to their corresponding declarators while generating warnings if there is any undeclared variables or functions. This method is called with the whole program, before any Cetus passes by default and provides a short cut to the declaration point, which enables faster access to the declaration when necessary. Pass writers can call this routine after changing a certain part of the program, e.g., a specific program section within a scope, to reflect the change due to new insertion of declaration.
        Parameters:
        t - the input cetus IR.

      • isGlobal

        public static boolean isGlobal​(Symbol symbol)
        Checks if the given symbol is declared as a global variable.
        Parameters:
        symbol - the symbol of the variable.
        Returns:
        true if the variable is global.

      • isLocal

        public static boolean isLocal​(Symbol symbol)
        Checks if the given symbol is declared as a local variable. This checking should be made along with other types of checking since the formal parameters are not part of the IR tree.
        Parameters:
        symbol - the symbol of the variable.
        Returns:
        true if the variable is local.

      • isOrphan

        public static boolean isOrphan​(Symbol symbol)
        Checks if the given symbol does not belong to the IR tree. There can be two types of orphan symbol -- 1) formal parameters, 2) other temporary variables not in the tree.
        Parameters:
        symbol - the symbol of the variable.
        Returns:
        true if the variable is orphan.

      • isFormal

        public static boolean isFormal​(Symbol symbol,
                               Procedure proc)
        Checks if the given symbol is declared as a formal variable. This utility function is using a weak point of the current IR hierarchy; formal parameters are not part of the IR tree but just a satellite data of a procedure object.
        Parameters:
        symbol - the symbol of the variable.
        Returns:
        true if the variable is formal.

      • isFormal

        public static boolean isFormal​(Symbol symbol)
        Checks if the given symbol is declared as a formal variable.
        Parameters:
        symbol - the symbol to be checked.
        Returns:
        true if the symbol represents a formal parameter, false otherwise.

      • exprsToSymbols

        public static java.util.List<Symbol> exprsToSymbols​(java.util.List<Expression> exprs)
        Returns a list of symbols by taking symbol object out of the expressions in the given list.
        Parameters:
        exprs - the list of requested expressions.
        Returns:
        the list of symbols that represent each expression.

      • isPointerParameter

        public static boolean isPointerParameter​(Symbol param)
        Checks if the given symbol is a parameter and a pointer-compatible symbol. Any array declarator is a pointer-compatible symbol.
        Parameters:
        param - the parameter symbol to be checked.
        Returns:
        true if param is pointer-compatible.

      • getNativeSpecifiers

        public static java.util.List getNativeSpecifiers​(Traversable t,
                                                 Symbol symbol)
        Returns C-native specifiers for the given symbol.
        Parameters:
        t - the traversable object where search starts from.
        symbol - the symbol object of interest.
        Returns:
        the list of resolved specifiers without any user specifiers.

      • isStruct

        public static boolean isStruct​(Symbol symbol,
                               Traversable tr)
        Checks if the given symbol is a user-defined struct type. Notice that the first parameter symbol should exist as a traversable object.
        Parameters:
        symbol - the symbol object to be checked.
        tr - the traversable object to be searched.

      • getClassDeclaration

        public static ClassDeclaration getClassDeclaration​(Symbol symbol,
                                                   Traversable tr)
        Returns the user-defined class declaration for the given symbol. Notice that it does not deferentiate "a" and "*a".
        Parameters:
        symbol - the symbol object to be checked.
        tr - the traversable object to be searched.

      • getOrphanID

        public static Identifier getOrphanID​(java.lang.String name)
        Returns an incomplete Identifier whose relevant symbol is not defined. This method is equivalent to the constructor of Identifier with a raw string name, which is now hidden to external world.

      • addSymbols

        public static void addSymbols​(SymbolTable table,
                              Declaration decl)
        Adds symbols to a symbol table and checks for duplicates.
        Parameters:
        table - The symbol table to add the symbols to.
        decl - The declaration of the symbols. symbols in the table.

      • findSymbol

        public static Declaration findSymbol​(SymbolTable table,
                                     IDExpression name)
        Searches for a symbol by name in the table. If the symbol is not in the table, then parent tables will be searched.
        Parameters:
        table - The initial table to search.
        name - The name of the symbol to locate.
        Returns:
        a Declaration if the symbol is found, or null if it is not found. The Declaration may contain multiple declarators, of which name will be one, unless the SingleDeclarator pass has been run on the program.

      • getParentTables

        protected static java.util.List<SymbolTable> getParentTables​(Traversable obj)
        Returns a list of parent symbol tables.

      • getUnusedID

        public static IDExpression getUnusedID​(SymbolTable table)
        Returns a randomly-generated name that is not found in the table.
        Parameters:
        table - The table to search.
        Returns:
        a unique name.

      • removeSymbols

        protected static void removeSymbols​(SymbolTable table,
                                    Declaration decl)
        Removes the symbols declared by the declaration from the symbol table.
        Parameters:
        table - The table from which to remove the symbols.
        decl - The declaration of the symbols.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the new identifier.

        Parameters:

        specs - the type specifiers.
        aspec - the array specifier.
        name - the string from which name is derived.

      • getArrayTemp

        public static Identifier getArrayTemp​(Traversable where,
                                      java.util.List specs,
                                      java.util.List aspecs,
                                      java.lang.String name)
        Returns a new identifier derived from the given IR object, type list, array specifiers and name. If specs contains any pointer specifiers, they are automatically separated and inserted into the list of specifiers that belong to the new VariableDeclarator object.
        Parameters:
        where - the IR object from which scope is derived.
        specs - the type specifiers.
        aspecs - the array specifier.
        name - the string from which name is derived.
        Returns:
        the new identifier.

        Parameters:

        public static boolean isPointer​(Expression e)
        Checks if the symbol is a pointer type variable. The input expression should represent a variable. Otherwise it will return true.
        Parameters:
        e - the expression to be tested.

      • isInteger

        public static boolean isInteger​(java.util.List specifiers)

      • getExactExpressionType

        public static java.util.List<Specifier> getExactExpressionType​(Expression e)
        Returns the exact type of the given expression, tracking all specifiers relevant to the expression. For example, the returned list contains the type specifiers and array specifiers for an identifier declared as an array type.
        Parameters:
        e - the expression to be examined.
        Returns:
        the type of the expression.

      • getExpressionType

        public static java.util.List getExpressionType​(Expression e)
        Returns a list of specifiers of the given expression.
        Parameters:
        e - the given expression.
        Returns:
        the list of specifiers.

      • findSymbol

        public static Declaration findSymbol​(SymbolTable table,
                                     java.lang.String sname)
        Searches for a symbol by String sname in the table. If the symbol is not in the table, then parent tables will be searched breadth-first. If multiple symbols have the same String name, the first one found during the search will be returned.
        Parameters:
        table - The initial table to search.
        sname - The String name of the symbol (Symbol.getSymbolName()) to locate.
        Returns:
        a Declaration if the symbol is found, or null if it is not found. The Declaration may contain multiple declarators, of which sname will be one, unless the SingleDeclarator pass has been run on the program.

      • getVariableType

        public static java.util.LinkedList getVariableType​(Expression e)
        Returns a list of specifiers of the expression.

      • getTable

        protected static java.util.Map<IDExpression,​Declaration> getTable​(SymbolTable symtab)
        Returns the look-up table that is internal to the given symbol table object. Exposing the table access to public may incur inconsistent snapshot of any symbol table object and its look-up table. Only read-only access will be provided through SymbolTable interface.
        Parameters:
        symtab - the given symbol table object.
        Returns:
        the internal look-up table, null if any exceptions occur.

      • relinkSymbols

        protected static void relinkSymbols​(SymbolTable symtab)
        Updates the symbol links in every Identifier object within the specified symbol table object. This operation is necessary when a symbol table object is cloned (or similar case).

      • setSymbolName

        public static void setSymbolName​(Symbol symbol,
                                 java.lang.String name,
                                 SymbolTable symtab)
        Renames the specified symbol within the given symbol table object.
        Parameters:
        symbol - the symbol object to be renamed.
        name - the new name of the specified symbol.
        symtab - the symbol table object that contains symbol.

      • containsSpecifier

        public static boolean containsSpecifier​(Symbol symbol,
                                        Specifier spec)
        Checks if the specified symbol object contains the given specifier. This functionality can also be provided through Symbol.getTypeSpecifiers() or Symbol.getArraySpecifiers() but they consume extra memory for the returned list.
        Parameters:
        symbol - the symbol to be checked.
        spec - the specifier to be searched for.
        Returns:
        true if a matching specifier is found.

      • CollectArrayAccesses

        public static void CollectArrayAccesses​(Symbol input_arr_sym,
                                        java.util.Set<ArrayAccess> accesses)

      • HasMultipleAccesses

        public static boolean HasMultipleAccesses​(Symbol input_arr)

      • clearAccesses

        public static void clearAccesses()

      • CollectAssignedValues

        public static void CollectAssignedValues​(Symbol input_arr_sym,
                                         java.util.List<Expression> values)

      • getArrayAccesses

        public static java.util.Set<ArrayAccess> getArrayAccesses​(Symbol array)

      • getAssignedValues

        public static java.util.List<Expression> getAssignedValues​(Symbol array)
